intro: Petrea martiana, commonly known as the Brazilian jasmine, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial shade. Petrea martiana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and pleasant aroma.
